metadata.synopsis: Ferg is a Sharran lookout instructed to watch out for Shadowheart but also works as a fence and money launderer for the Sharran cult. Players can convince him to offer his unique and unusual wares for trade.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to Refugee camp2. Talk to Ferg

36.speaker: Ferg Drogher
36.text: If you're looking for companionship, I hear they can cater to almost every taste in Sharess' Caress. I'm not on offer, unfortunately.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: You mentioned you had wares to trade?

45.speaker: Ferg Drogher
45.text: I took you for one of them for a moment. The refugees, that is.

49.speaker: Ferg Drogher
49.text: You're a recent arrival for sure, still bearing dust from the road... but you have something they lack. Dignity.

52.speaker: Ferg Drogher
52.text: These wretches have nowhere to call home, nothing to live off but what they carry, and nobody to help them but themselves... and me, of course.

47.speaker: Ferg Drogher
47.text: Charity is a luxury. Fickle, occasional gestures from guilty hearts. I run a business.

90.speaker: Ferg Drogher
90.text: You'd be shocked by the sort of things they bring with them. Gold and jewels they can't easily exchange. Heirlooms, rarities, sentimental items - even cremation urns...

2.speaker: Ferg Drogher
2.text: Alas, you cannot eat grandmother's ashes, nor can you easily trade a golden candelabra for a bowl of soup. That is where I come in - liquidity. Their heirlooms, for my gold.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I have an acquaintance you might be more willing to deal with. Her name is Shadowheart.

70.speaker: Ferg Drogher
70.text: Is that so? Well perhaps you should retrieve her then.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: So you buy their heirlooms and valuables at a low rate? Genius - I applaud you.

63.speaker: Ferg Drogher
63.text: A pity more don't share your open mind. I always say it's just business, but some don't see it that way.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You're taking advantage of the desperate.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: A carrion bird would have more dignity. This city feeds on those that need it most.
60.context: NodeContext: Bitter. Seeing evidence of the unfortunate being taken advantage of.

89.speaker: Ferg Drogher
89.text: An exchange of objects, nothing more. We all lose everything in the end.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *While it's an odd philosophy for a racketeer - the sentiment would fit a follower of the Nightbringer perfectly.*

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *A curious philosophy. Better suited to a follower of the Shar then some common racketeer.*

57.speaker: Player
57.text: And what do you do with all these goods you're acquiring?

53.speaker: Ferg Drogher
53.text: There is an enterprise within the city that I help to support. I know I said I wasn't given to charity, but this place is dear to my heart.

37.speaker: Ferg Drogher
37.text: I'd tell you more, but they value discretion above all. As do I.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: This gemstone you sell bought seems to be a perfect fit for a ring I found on a dead body...

17.speaker: Ferg Drogher
17.text: Is that so? What a remarkable coincidence... or perhaps not.

32.speaker: Ferg Drogher
32.text: These are desperate people - who is to say what lengths some of them may have gone to, just to earn the money to survive?

16.speaker: Ferg Drogher
16.text: A tragedy, really - but we must not judge. Perhaps I could show you some of my special goods to take your mind off this ugliness?

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Sure, show me what you have.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: You're a little too eager to brush off that dead body.

6.speaker: Ferg Drogher
6.text: Of course I am. Dead bodies are bad for business - as are people asking the wrong sort of question.
6.context: NodeContext: Vaguest hint of a threat

68.speaker: Ferg Drogher
68.text: Now. would you like to see what I have to offer, or would you like to leave? I'll be quite content, either way.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: This gemstone I bought seems to be a perfect fit for a ring I found on a dead body...

92.speaker: Player
92.text: So, how long have you worshipped Shar?

78.speaker: Ferg Drogher
78.text: Perhaps you are cannier than I first gave credit to be. I have some very special wares reserved for exclusive clientele... but I think you've earned a peek.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: That's it? You're just a merchant?

0.speaker: Ferg Drogher
0.text: Just a merchant. At least look at what's on offer before you embarrass yourself.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: There wares are too exotic to have been purchased from refugees, surely. Who's your supplier?

56.speaker: Ferg Drogher
56.text: Trade secrets. But I can guarantee you that nothing I have to offer was stolen - it was all given happily and willingly. Every last item.
56.context: NodeContext: Amused by a private joke. His claim is technically true

87.speaker: Player
87.text: What about that ring? Seems that was stolen.

55.speaker: Ferg Drogher
55.text: Well in that case, I can only assume whoever stole it then gave it to me willingly.

5.speaker: Ferg Drogher
5.text: Dangerous places, camps like these. According to Baldur's Mouth, you never know who might be a cut-throat.
5.context: NodeContext: Slippery smile. 'Yeah I killed him, but good luck proving it'

59.speaker: Player
59.text: It isn't just about gold for you, is it? There's more this that you're letting on...

91.speaker: Ferg Drogher
91.text: You're like a dog with a bone, aren't you?

64.speaker: Ferg Drogher
64.text: My, your imagination runs hot, doesn't it? Perhaps you should turn to poetry, or offer your services to Baldur's Mouth. I hear those rag traders enjoy a bit of fiction.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: A slippery fellow. Perhaps his thoughts will reveal what his lips won't.

86.speaker: Ferg Drogher
86.text: Fool. Think anyone will miss you if you vanish in a place like this? Let's find out...
86.context: NodeContext: Aggressive (player was caught trying to read his mind) combat ensues after

8.speaker: Ferg Drogher
8.text: Difficult to get a good day's trade done when I'm expected to keep watch for Shadowheart at the same time. Who knows when she'll finally turn up?

81.speaker: Player
81.text: That's despicable conduct - you should aid the needy, not exploit them.

15.speaker: Ferg Drogher
15.text: Why, I am aiding them. They gain both the gold they need, and lose the material desires weighing them down.

98.speaker: Halsin
98.text: Even carrion birds would not stoop so low.

13.speaker: Ferg Drogher
13.text: It is a most welcome absence, in my estimation.
13.context: NodeContext: absence said with relish here

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *The phrase 'welcome absence' catches in your mind - it is the refrain of a popular Sharran hymn.*

74.speaker: Player
74.text: A tithe must always be paid - no matter how harsh. Such is life.

66.speaker: Ferg Drogher
66.text: Hear hear. Though I'd keep your speech low, friend - not many share our outlook on the matter.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Sounds like you've got wares for sale. Mind if I take a look?

54.speaker: Ferg Drogher
54.text: Welcome. You see to peruse the special goods, I take it?

85.speaker: Ferg Drogher
85.text: Back again? It is nice to converse with someone who isn't circling the drain, like this lot. Looking on their maudlin faces does sap my spirits...
85.context: NodeContext: Referring the refugees present in the general area around him
